body_html:
Ok, now I'm able to run the test with a GPU. Unfortunately, both //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:check_ops_test and //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:check_ops_test_gpu are passing on my test machine.

Looking a bit more closely at the error message above, it appears that the GPU CI machine adds some leading whitespace when it prints out floating point tensors. I've added some slack to the regexes in check_ops_test.py that should hopefully resolve the issue. Could you please rerun the "GPU Python3" CI build?

Looking a bit more closely at the error message above, it appears that the GPU CI machine adds some leading whitespace when it prints out floating point tensors. I've added some slack to the regexes in check_ops_test.py that should hopefully resolve the issue. Could you please rerun the "GPU Python3" CI build?
body:
Ok, now I'm able to run the test with a GPU. Unfortunately, both `//tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:check_ops_test` and `//tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:check_ops_test_gpu` are passing on my test machine.

Looking a bit more closely at the error message above, it appears that the GPU CI machine adds some leading whitespace when it prints out floating point tensors. I've added some slack to the regexes in `check_ops_test.py` that should hopefully resolve the issue. Could you please rerun the "GPU Python3" CI build?
